title: Two integrated navigation units (INU) are located in the nos…
caption_en: Two integrated navigation units (INU) are located in the nose avionics bay.

title: The INU is a complete self-contained navigation system. It c…
caption_en: The INU is a complete self-contained navigation system. It contains the VOR, localizer, glideslope and marker beacon receiver module, the ADF module and a six-channel scanning DME module. Each module has its own independent housing and power supply.

title: The NAV receiver module consists of VORLocalizer (LOC) recei…
caption_en: The NAV receiver module consists of VORLocalizer (LOC) receiver, glideslope receiver and marker beacon receiver.

title: The VOR system operates with a frequency range of to MHz. Th…
caption_en: The VOR system operates with a frequency range of to MHz. The LOC frequency range is to MHz. Both have channel spacing of 50 KHz.

title: The VORLOC antennas are mounted on each side of the vertical…
caption_en: The VORLOC antennas are mounted on each side of the vertical fin. The left antenna is connected to VORLOC receiver 1, and the right antenna to VORLOC receiver 2.

title: The glideslope receiver provides 40-channel glideslope opera…
caption_en: The glideslope receiver provides 40-channel glideslope operation for convention ILS system. It has frequency range of to MHz with channel spacing of KHz. The glideslope antenna is located inside the radome.

title: Included in the NAV receiver module is a 75 MHz marker beaco…
caption_en: Included in the NAV receiver module is a 75 MHz marker beacon receiver. This conventional marker receiver used in ILS provides for detecting the three tones of the marker beacon.

title: This single-channel fixed-frequency receiver is highly selec…
caption_en: This single-channel fixed-frequency receiver is highly selective and will provide marker beacon annunciations on the PFDs and audio. The marker beacon annunciation appears flashing in a white box below ADI and slightly to the right. The marker beacon audio can be heard on the headset and through cockpit speaker by appropriate selection on the audio control panel.

title: The Nav receiver module frequency is selected on RMU in the …
caption_en: The Nav receiver module frequency is selected on RMU in the NAV window. The top frequency is the active frequency and the bottom, the preset frequency.

title: When a VOR frequency is selected active, the VOR receiver is…
caption_en: When a VOR frequency is selected active, the VOR receiver is activated to provide navigation data to The crew, however, must select the navigation source on the by depressing the NAV button on the on-side display controller. Touch the NAV button on the display controller.

title: Pressing the NAV button select VOR as the navigation source …
caption_en: Pressing the NAV button select VOR as the navigation source as shown. The will provide the crew with lateral guidance into and out of VOR station on a selected radial.

title: If the PFDs receive navigation data from their respective VO…
caption_en: If the PFDs receive navigation data from their respective VOR receivers, the desired course, VOR navigation source, DME distance, course pointer and the deviation indicator are green in colour.

title: If a common VOR receiver is used on both PFDs, the desired c…
caption_en: If a common VOR receiver is used on both PFDs, the desired course, navigation source, DME distance, course pointer and the deviation indicator are amber in colour. This was discussed in the Avionics Part 1, under display controller.

title: The bearing selectors, in the NAV position, provide bearing …
caption_en: The bearing selectors, in the NAV position, provide bearing pointers on the compass. Bearing pointer 1 (in cyan) is from VOR receiver 1 and bearing pointer 2 (in white), VOR receiver 2. Bearing pointer annunciations appear at the left bottom of the The pointers will not appear if the signals are invalid or not received.

title: If the frequency is ILS, the LOC, GS and receivers are tuned…
caption_en: If the frequency is ILS, the LOC, GS and receivers are tuned for ILS approach. In this case, the navigation source is ILS. The will provide localizer and glideslope guidance. If the navigation sources are independent, navigation display is green, as is seen above. If the navigation source is common, navigation display is yellow. Click Advance to see the picture.

title: The pictures above show red crosses on the if the VOR and IL…
caption_en: The pictures above show red crosses on the if the VOR and ILS signals are invalid.

title: Distance measuring equipment (DME) is a six-channel scanning…
caption_en: Distance measuring equipment (DME) is a six-channel scanning DME that simultaneously tracks four selected DME channels for distance, groundspeed, and time to station. It also tracks additional two channels for IDENT function. These channels are not used as they are meant for preset VOR channel.

title: Two of the four channels are controlled by the pilot for IDE…
caption_en: Two of the four channels are controlled by the pilot for IDENT, distance, time-to-station, and groundspeed. The other two channels are dedicated to the

title: The antennas are located at the belly of the aircraft. Forwa…
caption_en: The antennas are located at the belly of the aircraft. Forward antenna is for DME receiver 1 and the aft antenna is for DME receiver 2.

title: The DME station used in civilian aviation is normally co-loc…
caption_en: The DME station used in civilian aviation is normally co-located with VORLOCIILS facility. Selecting a VORLOCIILS frequency will automatically tune the DME receiver. The DME has a range capability

title: The DME distance readout is indicated on the below the navig…
caption_en: The DME distance readout is indicated on the below the navigation source annunciation. It has the same colour as the navigation source.

title: The DME system on this aircraft has a DME hold function. Thi…
caption_en: The DME system on this aircraft has a DME hold function. This function allows VOR and DME frequencies to be selected separately into their respective receivers. When the DME hold is activated, the DME distance readout on the is followed by an amber H. This indicates to the crew that the distance readout on the may not be referenced to the VOR station that the crew is tracking.

title: In the above example, the VOR receiver is tuned to VOR, but …
caption_en: In the above example, the VOR receiver is tuned to VOR, but the DME distance on the is from VOR.

title: It is recommended that operating in DME hold during VOR capt…
caption_en: It is recommended that operating in DME hold during VOR capture and tracking operation should be avoided. When in DME hold, the flight director computer cannot use DME distance for lateral gain programming.

title: The DME system is equipped with facility to receive distance…
caption_en: The DME system is equipped with facility to receive distance from TACAN. These are old DME station transmitting only distance information to the aircraft. The frequencies are in channels, e.g. channel as shown in the RMU. The distance readout is on the An amber H is also shown after the distance.

title: An invalid DME signal is indicated by amber dashed line as s…
caption_en: An invalid DME signal is indicated by amber dashed line as shown.

title: The integrated navigation unit consists of an ADF receiver m…
caption_en: The integrated navigation unit consists of an ADF receiver module. The system provides crew with continuous relative bearing readout to low-frequency homing stations, radio beacon, and broadcast stations.

title: The ADF antenna is installed on top of the aircraft. It rece…
caption_en: The ADF antenna is installed on top of the aircraft. It receives signals in the frequency range of KHz to KHz and provides the signals to the module. The receiver processes the signals into audio and bearing

title: The ADF has four modes of operation: In the ANT mode, ADF re…
caption_en: The ADF has four modes of operation: In the ANT mode, ADF receives only audio signal; it does not compute bearing. In ADF mode, ADF receives signal and computes relative bearing to station. In BFO, ADF adds a beat frequency oscillation for reception of carrier wave signals. In VOICE mode, ADF opens the IF bandwidth for better aural reception. This mode is not used for navigation.

title: Selecting the left knob to ADF position causes bearing point…
caption_en: Selecting the left knob to ADF position causes bearing pointer 1 (in cyan) to appear on the compass; and selecting right knob to ADF causes bearing pointer 2 (in white) to be displayed also. Bearing pointer 1 is from ADF receiver 1 and bearing 2, from ADF receiver 2.

title: Selection of bearing pointers is accompanied by the appropri…
caption_en: Selection of bearing pointers is accompanied by the appropriate annunciations displayed below the If the signals received are invalid, the pointers will disappear from the compass. Watch.

title: This will be discussed in RMU operation.
caption_en: This will be discussed in RMU operation.
